channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Streetlight obscured by vegetation, 14th January
item.description:
Streetlight number 36 obscured by vegetation, Springbank Road Cheltenham. Opposite the park and next to the old Holmlea farm.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 124, Springbank Road, Springbank, Cheltenham

item.title: Footpath appears blocked and no markers on entrance to field, 14th January
item.description:
On the footpath nearest The Leigh heading towards the Coombe Hill Canal the style appears to have been blocked by fencing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmiths Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury

item.title: Multiple potholes deep enough to make serious damage to suspension or three and wheels, 14th January
item.description:
All potholes are right when you turn left from Eveshem road towards meadow way in the very beginning of the street Been there for ages and after the heavy rains they just getting worse and deeper

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadoway, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch fell and just missed passers by on the pavement, 14th January
item.description:
Outside property large tree on highway needs pollarding All of the trees do after Church road end upto Old Bath Road. The large birds jump around the trees and the branches fall as well as high winds causing this large branch to fall. This has been an ongoing issue for years. The trees will be a lot healthier if they were cut back. The street lights can’t light the pavements up in parts because the trees are so large.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 216a, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised pavement due to trees roots in a private garden, 14th January
item.description:
Just walking into Pilley lane from Leckhampton Road. You have already repaired the corner so thank you. It’s just a shame that the workmen didn’t report that the pavement is quite bad all around that area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 174, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights out, very dark, unsafe, 13th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Gotherington Lane, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: End of stone wall damaged with rubble lying on pavement and road, 13th January
item.description:
The damaged wall is immediately outside the Army Cadet Building at 24 Church Rd, Bishops Cleeve, Cheltenham GL52 8LR. The wall appears to have either been hit by a vehicle or damaged purposely. The rubble from.the wall is littering the public pathway as well as partly on the road. I've done my best to brush it out of the road so it's out of the way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Web Reference: 5324058 Enquiry Number: 22035990 Issue: SL-Illuminated Bollard or Sign Location: Opposite the end of Winton Road in Warden Hill Road. It has been like this for at least 14 days - I pass it every day. Site: WARDEN HILL ROAD Please be advised that the equipment has now been repaired and it has been left in working order. Your enquiry will now be closed.The problem is still present. I checked on Thurs and Fri at 3pm, 13th January
item.description:
Web Reference: 5324058 Enquiry Number: 22035990 Issue: SL-Illuminated Bollard or Sign Location: Opposite the end of Winton Road in Warden Hill Road. It has been like this for at least 14 days - I pass it every day. Site: WARDEN HILL ROAD Please be advised that the equipment has now been repaired and it has been left in working order. Your enquiry will now be closed. The problem is still present, as of Thurs and Fri of this week, when I passed the sign it was not flashing and one light was permanently on
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Warden Hill Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign isn't working correctly (part only or random activation)

item.title: Holes in road from removal of studs/markings, 13th January
item.description:
On the B4063 between the fire station and entrance to Pirton Fields there are holes in the road from the removal of studs/road markings prior to the cycle lane being installed. These are noticeable holes that ideally require filling at least temporarily. It could be argued that the road needs attention since the works to install the cycle lane has caused a patchwork surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Close, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Injury caused by sign not visible in dark, 12th January
item.description:
Sign denoting roadworks is in the middle of a very narrow pavement and cannot be seen in the dark in an ultra low light zone, which our village is. Sustained injury to face, almost knocking out front teeth. Sign hit with such force it hit the ground, despite being weighed down with a sandbag or equivalent. Extremely dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30,32, Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
